thread.title: Logansport High School Teacher surprised with $25,000 reward | News | ktbs.com
thread.title_full: Logansport High School Teacher surprised with $25,000 reward | News | ktbs.com

title: Logansport High School Teacher surprised with $25,000 reward | News | ktbs.com
text:
LOGANSPORT, La. - A Logansport High School teacher is now $25,000 richer after receiving what some call the Oscars of Teacher.
Chardray Wilson is the third educator in Louisiana to win the Milken Educator Awards.
Wilson is a former Logansport High Student who returned to the school to teach math and science after college.
She was surprised with her unrestricted $25,000 Milken Educator Award in front of cheering students, colleagues, dignitaries and media: the very community that raised her.
"A foundation of any successful education system is its teachers. Today, we honor Charday Wilson who has gone above and beyond, setting the standard for excellence in her schools," said State Superintendent Dr. Cade Brumley.
"Her commitment to empowering fellow educators across the district has sparked growth and collaboration that has benefited the entire parish."
The Milken Educator Awards inspires educators, students, and entire communities to celebrate, elevate, and activate the K-12 teaching profession.
